content: <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Idaho Department of Water Resources</origin><pubdate>19909090</pubdate><title>1:2,000,000 Scale Lakes</title><edition>1</edition><geoform Sync="TRUE">vector digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Boise, Idaho</pubplace><publish>ID Dept of Water Resources</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://www.idwr.idaho.gov/gisdata/gis_data.htm</onlink><ftname Sync="TRUE">hyd2mil_lakes</ftname></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>Hyd250 was created from the 1:100,000 scale hydrography. Certain outdated attributes in the coverage aat were removed.   This generalize coverage came from the attribute seg. Arcs with seg numbers less than 500 were legacy arcs from the 1:250,000 scale hydrography.   Hyd250 was created from the 1:100,000 scale hydrography. Certain outdated attributes in the coverage aat were removed.   This generalize coverage came from the attribute seg. Arcs with seg numbers less than 500 were legacy arcs from the 1:250,000 scale hydrography.    (description): the u.s. geological survey (USGS) in cooperation with federal and state agencies, and nw Indian tribes has produced a 1:100,000-scale river reach data layer for the pacific northwest that will serve water-resource management applications for the next decade or more. The pacific northwest (pnw) river reach files are a geo-referenced river reach data layer encompasses the Columbia river basin within the conterminous united states u.s. environmental protection agency's (usepa) reach codes. This encoding process was a primary task of the pnw river reach project. Usepa's reach identifiers are an integral hydrologic component in regional rivers study known as the northwest environmental data base(ned). Ned is an ongoing effort by federal and state agencies within the region to compile reach-specific information on rivers in Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Montana.</abstract><purpose>A unique conflation algorithm was developed by the USGS-WRD in Portland, that transferred the USEPA reach codes and other meaningful attributes from USEPA's 1:250,000-scale RF2 Files to the 1:100,000-scale hydrography. The new 1:100,000-scale PNW Reach Files were designed so reach-specific could be extracted from a stream network in an upstream or downstream direction using associated feature attribute tables or within a Geographic Information System. In Idaho, the Dept. of Water Resources uses these data in its basin planning efforts and the Dept. Fish & Game to map information in its Idaho River Information System (IRIS).</purpose><supplinf>The data documented in this file are split up between stream centers (for networking applications) and water bodies, including lakes, ponds, reservoirs, and wide rivers. The data are tiled and distributed by Hydrologic Unit</supplinf><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>19969696</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>Current as of 1996</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc Sync="TRUE">-117.018692</westbc><eastbc Sync="TRUE">-110.726104</eastbc><northbc Sync="TRUE">48.842007</northbc><southbc Sync="TRUE">41.993058</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">2278346.911556</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">2740422.692970</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">1203305.450049</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">1960116.481573</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ESRI Geography Network Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>Rivers, Surface_Water</themekey></theme><place><placekt>None</placekt><placekey>Idaho</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>Access: data are available under the provisions of the Idaho</accconst><useconst>public domain (no restrictions on access or use</useconst><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntper>Linda Davis</cntper><cntorg>Idaho Dept. of Water Resources</cntorg></cntperp><cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing</addrtype><address>322 East Front Street</address><city>Boise</city><state>Idaho</state><postal>83720</postal><country>USA</country></cntaddr><cntvoice>(208) 287-4800</cntvoice><cntfax>(208) 287-6700</cntfax><cntemail>gisinfo@idwr.idaho.gov</cntemail><hours>8:00 to 5:00</hours><cntinst>most datasets available at: <ftp://ftp.state.id.us/pub/gisdata> (Digital)Format Name: ARC/INFO EXPORT File Decompression Technique: nothing in addition to ARC EXPORT Transfer Size (MB): varies by file Online Option: Network Resource Name: <ftp://ftp.state.id.us/pub/gisdata/hydro> (check after Fall '96) Access Instructions: The address above is in an URL format suitable for use by most Web browsers. Click on the local README file for further information. If using a command-line ftp package, the syntax is as follows: ftp ftp.state.id.us login: anonymous password: {supply your email account name} cd /pub/gisdata/hydro get README {view the README file with a text editor on your computer}</cntinst><cntorgp><cntorg /><cntper /></cntorgp></cntinfo></ptcontac><native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI Sync="TRUE">16</attwidth></attr></detailed><overview><eaover>File Name: each data set's file name uses the following construct: an 's' (stream centers) or 'b' (banks) followed by the last seven digits of the eight-digit Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) name (the first number, usually '1,' is dropped); for example, b7050114, is the banks coverage of HUC 17050114  HYD100K.AAT:  COLUMN   ITEM NAME        WIDTH OUTPUT  TYPE N.DEC  ALTERNATE NAME 1  FNODE#                 4     5     B      - 5  TNODE#                 4     5     B      - 9  LPOLY#                 4     5     B      - 13  RPOLY# 6     6     I      - 35  MINOR1                 6     6     I      - 41  MINOR2                 6     6     I      - 47  MINOR3                 6     6     I      - 53  HUC                    8     8 170  QUAD100               26    26     C      - 196  QUAD100-2             26    26     C      - 222  QUAD75                25    25     C      - 247  QUAD75-2              25    25     C      - 272 SAVENEG                1     1     I      - 289  SINUOUS                5     5     N      2 294  UHUC1                  8     8     I      - 302  UPNTR1                 5     5     I      - 307 I      - 307  UPLINK2               13    13     I      - 320  UPLINK3               13    13     I      - 334  DOWNLINK              13    13     I      -</eaover><eadetcit>V. Data Dictionary (Repeat for each associated table or database) Overview (summary): ARC/INFO coverage attribute database descriptions Citation USGS publication water resources investigations, Report 94-4043. Also see s<huc cover>.aat, b<huc cover>.aat, b<huc cover>.pat, hydro.nar , database files. A. Entity (table) Element Label (table name): s<huc cover>.aat Definition (description): Stream Center Arc Attribute Table B. AAT Attribute Elements Attribute Label: MAJOR1 Definition (description): NMD Digital Line Graphs (DLG) from 100K maps. 50 identifies feature as hydrography. See USGS, Digital Line Graphs from 1:100,000-Scale Maps, Data Users Guide 2, 1989 Domain: 50 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 6 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 98% Accuracy Explanation: Taken from DLGs and compared with 100K quads. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: MINOR1 Definition (description): NMD DLG from 100K maps. 412 identifies the feature as a 999 was used to indicate artificial features such as centerlines. To identify other codes, see USGS, Digital Line Graphs from 1:100,000-Scale Maps, Data Users Guide 2, 1989 Domain: As shown in DATASOURCE reference Format Type: Integer Format Length: 6 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Original codes taken from DLGs and compared with 100K quads. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: MINOR2 Definition (description): NMD DLG from 100K maps. Descriptive code of 610 identifies the feature stream , (412) as intermittent. To identify other codes, see USGS, Digital Line Graphs from 1:100,000-Scale Maps, Data Users Guide 2, 1989 Domain: As shown in DATASOURCE reference Format Type: Integer Format Length: 6 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Original codes taken from DLGs and compared with 100K quads. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: MINOR3 Definition (description): NMD DLG from 100K maps. Rarely used for hydrography. Code of 111111 was used to indicate outlet reach for the basin, 888888 indicated headwater reach. See USGS, Digital Line Graphs from 1:100,000-Scale Maps, Data Users Guide 2, 1989 Domain: As shown in DATASOURCE reference Format Type: Integer Format Length: 6 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Original codes taken from DLGs and compared with 100K quads. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: HUC Definition (description): USGS Hydrologic Unit Code; Catalog Unit number Domain: As shown in DATASOURCE reference Format Type: Integer Format Length: 8 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 100% Accuracy Explanation: Checked with arc program (AML) and compared with hydrologic unit boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: SEG Definition (description): Reach segment number Domain: Positive Integers Format Type: Integer Format Length: 4 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 80% Accuracy Explanation: Checked by Idaho Fish and Game Department. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: RMI Definition (description): River Mile Index. Lowest reach with a particular SEG number has a RMI of 00.00. Domain: 00.00 to 99.99 Format Type: Numeric Format Length: 5.2 Measurement Resolution: 0.01 Units: Miles Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by ARC/INFO. Only an incorrect stream direction would result in an error. Measurement Frequency Attribute Label: FEAT_NAME Definition (description): Hydrographic Feature attribute name. Sources were form USEPA 1:250,000-scale Trace Files, 1:100,000-scale manuscripts, and NMD Geographic Names data base. Additional stream names were added from available resources. Domain: No Restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 60 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 80% Accuracy Explanation: Checked by Idaho Fish and Game Department and compared to 100K quad maps. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: FEAT_SRC Definition (description): Source of hydrographic feature; used for additional features added after DLG and hydrography editing. Domain: A1 - Origin of features was from NMD 1:100,000-scale DLG A2 - digitized from 1:100,000-scale manuscript A9 - manually added feature using GIS editor B1 - Origin was from NMD 1:24,000-scale DLG B2 - feature was digitized from 1:24,000-scale manuscript ** NOTE--these codes could be expanded to include features obtained from larger scale maps or GPS acquired data. Format Type: Character Format Length: 2 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 90% Accuracy Explanation: Checked against quadrangle maps. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: STATE Definition (description): Predominant state name a particular reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 4 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 100% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with state boudaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: STATE-2 Definition (description): Name of second most predominant state a reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 4 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 100% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with state boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: COUNTY Definition (description): Predominant County name a particular reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 15 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with county boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: COUNTY-2 Definition (description): Second most predominant county a reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 15 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with county boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: QUAD100 Definition (description): Predominant 100K - scale quad a reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 26 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with quad boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: QUAD100-2 Definition (description): Second most predominant 100K-scale quad a reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 26 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with quad boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: QUAD75 Definition (description): Predominant 24K-scale quad name a reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 25 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with quad boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: QUAD75-2 Definition (description): Second most predominant 24K-scale quad a reach falls within. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 25 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS and compared with quad boundaries. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: CEN Definition (description): Node number for an ALLOCATION center a reach was allocated from. Non-allocated reaches have a CEN value of 0. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Binary Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: N/A Accuracy Explanation: Attributes assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0 processing. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: CUMLENGTH Definition (description): Cumulative length of arcs traversed from any allocation center. Domain: Positive real number Format Type: Floating point Format Length: 12.2 Measurement Resolution: 0.01 Units: meters Accuracy: N/A Accuracy Explanation: Attributes assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0 processing. Measurement Frequency Attribute Label: DNARC Definition (description): Down arc. Arc number for reach below a given reach. Domain: Real number. Negative value indicates lowest reach. Format Type: Binary Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated with ARC program. Only an incorrect stream direction would result in an error. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: PNTR# Definition (description): Pointer number. Copy of Coverage# prior to ALLOCATION. Copy of internal number. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Binary Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: N/A Accuracy Explanation: Attributes assigned byARC/INFO 5.0 processing. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: SAVENEG Definition (description): Save negative. Flag item to indicate a feature blocked prior to ALLOCATION. Value of 1 indicated a blocked feature. Domain: 0 or 1 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 1 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 85% Accuracy Explanation: Non-transported--hand assigned. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: SINUOUS Definition (description): Reach sinuosity. Ratio of the true distance of a reach over its straight line. Domain: Greater than or equal to 1. Format Type: Numeric Format Length: 5.2 Measurement Resolution: 0.01 Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by ARC program. Scale dependant. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UHUC1 Definition (description): HUC number of upstream reach for a given reach. Domain: Between 01010000 and 21040000 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 8 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS. Only an incorrect stream direction would result in an error. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UPNTR1 Definition (description): POINTER# number of reach above a given reach. Domain: Positive integer Format Type: Integer Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Attribute assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UHUC2 Definition (description): HUC number of second upstream reach. Domain: Between 01010000 and 21040000 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 8 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS. Only an incorrect stream direction would result in an error. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UPNTR2 Definition (description): POINTER# number of second reach. Domain: Positive integer Format Type: Integer Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Attribute assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UHUC3 Definition (description): HUC number of third upstream reach. Domain: Between 01010000 and 21040000 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 8 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS. Only an incorrect stream direction would result in an error. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UPNTR3 Definition (description): POINTER# number of third reach upstream Domain: No Restrictions Format Type: Integer Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Attribute assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UFLAG Definition (description): Flag to indicate presence of a fourth upstream reach. True if more than 3 arcs flowing into one point, then UFLAG is set to 1. Domain: 0 or 1 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 1 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Attribute assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: DHUC Definition (description): HUC number of downstream reach for a given reach. Domain: Between 01010000 and 21040000 Format Type: Integer Format Length: 8 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Calculated by USGS. Only an incorrect stream direction would result in an error. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: DPNTR Definition (description): POINTER# number of downstream reach. Domain: Positive integer Format Type: Integer Format Length: 5 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Attribute assigned by ARC/INFO 5.0. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: CSEG Definition (description): Northwest Power Planning Council segment number. Domain: Positive integer. Format Type: Integer Format Length: 3 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: unknown Accuracy Explanation: Source is Northwest Power Planning Council, hand entered. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: CRMI Definition (description): Northwest Power Planning Council river mile number. Domain: 00.00 to 99.99 Format Type: Numeric Format Length: 5.2 Measurement Resolution: 0.01 Units: miles Accuracy: unknown Accuracy Explanation: Source is Northwest Power Planning Council, hand entered. Measurement Frequency Attribute Label: CNAME Definition (description): Northwest Power Planning Council added stream name. Domain: No restrictions Format Type: Character Format Length: 30 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: unknown Accuracy Explanation: Source is Northwest Power Planning Council, hand entered. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: RRN (redefined item) Definition (description): River Reach code for a reach: HUC + SEG + RMI. Domain: As given for each separate item. Format Type: Character Format Length: 17 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 80% Accuracy Explanation: Only as accurate as the input items; HUC, SEG, and RMI. Measurement Frequency: None Attribute Label: UPLINK1 (redefined item) Definition (description): River Reach code of upstream reach: UHUC1 + UPNTR1 Domain: As given for each separate item. Format Type: Integer Format Length: 13 Measurement Resolution: N/A Units: N/A Accuracy: 95% Accuracy Explanation: Only as accurate as the input items; DHUC and DPNTR. Measurement Frequency: None A. Measurement Frequency: None VI. Source Information (Repeat for each source used) Title USGS, Digital Line Graphs from 1:100,000-Scale Maps, Data Users Guide 2 Originator USGS National Mapping Division Publication Date: 1986 Source Contribution: All digital line work. Scale: 1:100,000 Type of Source Medium (&. condition): 9-track tape Title Geographic Names Information System Originator USGS National Mapping Division Publication Date: 1987 Source Contribution: Reference for hydrographic feature names. Scale: 24K or 62.5 K Type of Source Medium (&. condition): Digital file from 9-track tape. Title River Reach Trace File (RRF) Originator Environmental Protection Agency Publication Date: 1986/1987 Source Contribution: Original RRF information. Scale: 1:250,000 Type of Source Medium (&. condition): Aeronautical maps, unknown condition. Title USGS Quadrangle Map Originator USGS Mapping Division Publication Date: ca 1970s - 1990s Source Contribution: Reference map. Scale: 1:100,000 Type of Source Medium (&. condition): Paper map in good condition. Title USGS Quadrangle Map Originator USGS Mapping Division Publication Date: ca 1970s - 1990s Source Contribution: Reference map. Scale: 1:24,000 Type of Source Medium (&. condition): Paper map in good condition VII. Processing Steps (Repeat for each processing step) Date: 1990-1995 Source produced citation abbreviation (version): 1.0 Process Contact: Bruce Fisher E-Mail address: bjfisher@mapsdorprn.wr.usgs.gov Phone: (503) 251-3228 Description (& tolerances): Generalized procedures for constructing 100K scale Reach Files 1. Read 100K hydrography DLG's for each map into GIS. 2. Edgematch north and west edges of each map to adjacent 100K quads. 3. CLIP each 100K quad with adjusted Hydrologic Unit boundary. 4. APPEND clipped quad pieces together. 5. Correct internal node errors using automated snapping. 6. Remove non-attributed pseudo nodes. 7. Copy polygons to Waterbody coverage. 8. Edit out double-banked streams, shorelines,and braided areas and put into Water bodies coverage. 9. Add centerlines through waterbodies and wide streams and connector arcs from centerlines to tributaries. 10. Create Trace coverage from EPA Reach File. 11. Edit Trace, correcting stream names and topologic structure where 12. Adjust Trace segment endpoints to align with corresponding 100K endpoint. 13. CONFLATE (Transfer) Trace-ID from Trace reaches to corresponding reaches in 100K coverage. 14. Make check plots to verify results of conflation. 15. Transfer EPA extended attributes (SEG, LEVEL, SEQNUM, FLAG) to 100K reaches. 16. Assign unconflated 100K reaches a provisionary reach code. 17. Move provisionary codes to SEG. 18. Add State, County, and quad boundary items to reaches in 100K-scale Reach File. 19. Compute sinuosity for each reach. 20. Block man-made waterways, braided reaches, and other features determined as not part of the basin network by calculating their LENGTH item to negative. 21. Determine allocation centers. Usually mouth of basin. 22. ALLOCATE from centers. 23. WRITEALLOCATION ROUTING results to Reach File Arc Attribute Table. 24. Use DIRECTION item to flip reaches to flow in a downstream direction 25. Calculate PNTR# to internal record number of Arc Attribute Table 26. Unblock previously blocked arcs. 27. Calculate river mile for allocated reaches. 28. Compute upstream linkage. INFO program. 29. Order attributes in Reach Files and Water bodies coverage for consistency among Files. 30. Check Reach File using checking programs. 31. Manually add Northwest Power Planning Council reach codes, stream names and river miles. 32. Run final check programs 33. Archive Reach Files. 34. Distribute to states for review.</eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><distrib><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg /><cntper /></cntorgp><cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing</addrtype><address>322 East Front Street</address><city>Boise</city><state>Idaho</state><postal>83720</postal><country>USA</country></cntaddr><cntvoice>(208) 287-4800</cntvoice><cntemail>gisinfo@idwr.idaho.gov</cntemail><cntinst>Contact via email</cntinst><cntfax>(208) 287-6700</cntfax><hours>8:00 to 5:00</hours></cntinfo></distrib><resdesc>Downloadable Data</resdesc><stdorder><digform><digtinfo><transize>73.272</transize><dssize Sync="TRUE">0.245</dssize><formname>ESRI data format, dependent upon request</formname></digtinfo></digform><fees>To be determined at time of order</fees></stdorder><distliab>The Idaho Department of Water Resources is  making this data available as a public service. ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.0.1324</envirDesc><dataLang><languageCode Sync="TRUE" value="en" /></dataLang><idCitation><resTitle>1:2,000,000 Scale Lakes</resTitle><presForm><PresFormCd Sync="TRUE" value="005" /></presForm><resRefDate><refDate /><refDateType><DateTypCd value="001" /></refDateType></resRefDate></idCitation><spatRpType><SpatRepTypCd Sync="TRUE" value="001" /></spatRpType><dataExt><geoEle><GeoBndBox esriExtentType="native"><westBL Sync="TRUE">2278346.911556</westBL><eastBL Sync="TRUE">2740422.69297</eastBL><northBL Sync="TRUE">1960116.481573</northBL><southBL Sync="TRUE">1203305.450049</southBL><exTypeCode Sync="TRUE">1</exTypeCode></GeoBndBox></geoEle></dataExt><geoBox esriExtentType="decdegrees"><westBL Sync="TRUE">-117.018692</westBL><eastBL Sync="TRUE">-110.726104</eastBL><northBL Sync="TRUE">48.842007</northBL><southBL Sync="TRUE">41.993058</southBL><exTypeCode Sync="TRUE">1</exTypeCode></geoBox><idAbs>Hyd250 was created from the 1:100,000 scale hydrography. Certain outdated attributes in the coverage aat were removed.   This generalize coverage came from the attribute seg. Arcs with seg numbers less than 500 were legacy arcs from the 1:250,000 scale hydrography.   Hyd250 was created from the 1:100,000 scale hydrography. Certain outdated attributes in the coverage aat were removed.   This generalize coverage came from the attribute seg. Arcs with seg numbers less than 500 were legacy arcs from the 1:250,000 scale hydrography.    (description): the u.s. geological survey (USGS) in cooperation with federal and state agencies, and nw Indian tribes has produced a 1:100,000-scale river reach data layer for the pacific northwest that will serve water-resource management applications for the next decade or more. The pacific northwest (pnw) river reach files are a geo-referenced river reach data layer encompasses the Columbia river basin within the conterminous united states u.s. environmental protection agency's (usepa) reach codes. This encoding process was a primary task of the pnw river reach project. Usepa's reach identifiers are an integral hydrologic component in regional rivers study known as the northwest environmental data base(ned). Ned is an ongoing effort by federal and state agencies within the region to compile reach-specific information on rivers in Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Montana.</idAbs></dataIdInfo><mdLang><languageCode Sync="TRUE" value="en" /></mdLang><mdStanName Sync="TRUE">ISO 19115 Geographic Information -
